title: Resistivity - new resistance with one-3rd diameter

content.question: A piece of electrically conductive material is shaped into a long cylinder of length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and diameter <math alttext="D sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Its resistance is measured to be <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The material is then reshaped into a new cylinder by reducing its diameter to <math alttext="the fraction D sub 0, over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> while keeping its total volume the same. What is the resistance of the new cylinder?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
